All "Flush Out Points" on the floor requires warning signage
Check Required volume to be flushed from each system - hot & cold - calculations can be found in "WPD Pipework Flushing Folder" for time durations per area

Cold Water System - Start by opening tap located furthest from the meters, open others on the way back & observe time to ensure system has been sufficiently drained. Open outside taps for enough time to empty volume of the main line, then flush each toilet the required amount to empty each branch.
Hot Water System - Start by opening tap located closest to end of the return line, open others on the way back & observe time to ensure system has been sufficiently drained.

Flushing showerheads & hoses - let the shower hang down (without touching the ground) it will let the water drain out afterwards. The water in a showerhead & hose when it sits there inside can become a risk and also causes scale buildup.
Faucets/taps with an aerator on it, should be removed during flushing, to allow the outlet to flush at high volume.
All taps turned off & area made safe
Final sign off - Pass when satisfied to proceed (Any issues please comment & Add photos below)
